Sentencas: Synthesis of nanocrystalline gadolinium doped ceria (Ce0.9Gd0.1O1.95) was attempted by nitrate-fuel combustion technique involving different organic fuels namely urea, citric acid, glycine and poly ethylene glycol.
Titulo: Microhardness and fracture toughness of Ce0.9Gd0.1O1.95 for manufacturing solid oxide electrolytes

Sentencas: As-combusted ceria precursors were calcined at 700 degrees C for 2 h for obtaining fully dense, nanocrystalline ceria powders.
Titulo: Microhardness and fracture toughness of Ce0.9Gd0.1O1.95 for manufacturing solid oxide electrolytes

Sentencas: Cylindrical ceria discs were fabricated by uni-axial pressing and sintered intentionally at low temperature of 1200 degrees C for 2 h for assessing the sintering characteristics of the nano powders as well as the mechanical performance of the sintered ceria body.
Titulo: Microhardness and fracture toughness of Ce0.9Gd0.1O1.95 for manufacturing solid oxide electrolytes

Sentencas: The study confirms that the nano powders could be sintered to 98% theoretical sintered density at 1200 degrees C with a grain size of 400 nm to 1 mu m.
Titulo: Microhardness and fracture toughness of Ce0.9Gd0.1O1.95 for manufacturing solid oxide electrolytes

Sentencas: The sintered samples exhibited the Vickers microhardness of 8.82 +/- 0.2 GPa and the fracture toughness of 1.75 +/- 0.3 MPa m(1/2) at a load 20 N for glycine and citric acid fuels derived ceria, respectively.
Titulo: Microhardness and fracture toughness of Ce0.9Gd0.1O1.95 for manufacturing solid oxide electrolytes

Sentencas: A comparison between the fuels was made with respect to the sintering and mechanical properties of doped ceria.
Titulo: Microhardness and fracture toughness of Ce0.9Gd0.1O1.95 for manufacturing solid oxide electrolytes

Sentencas: Citric acid and glycine fuels resulted in sintered ceria with high hardness where as the urea and polyethylene fuels derived nano ceria
Titulo: Microhardness and fracture toughness of Ce0.9Gd0.1O1.95 for manufacturing solid oxide electrolytes
